title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns Bay Area Sanitation, which operates nearly 2,000 portable toilets serving construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025 and the video was produced for CNBC Make It.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, age 31
Company: Bay Area Sanitation
Fleet: almost 2,000 portable toilets
Service area: construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area
2025 income: $4.3 million
takeaways: Significant onsite sanitation demand exists for construction and event operations—account for vendor coordination in project planning.
Local service providers with multimillion-dollar revenues can be viable contractors for temporary onsite facilities during builds or maintenance.
For projects in dense urban regions, include sanitation logistics and vendor sourcing early in the procurement process to avoid delays.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this Microsoft Copilot video follows Jo as she discovers how Copilot Groups makes route planning easier. It highlights Copilot's role in simplifying route planning workflows using group-based assistance.
bullets: Jo explores the capabilities of Copilot Groups.
Primary focus is on making route planning easy.
Demonstrates Copilot's group-based approach to assistance.
Produced by the Microsoft Copilot channel.
Includes hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai
takeaways: Copilot Groups may streamline route planning for logistics and on-site operations.
Group-based assistance can improve coordination among teams handling routes.
Simplified planning workflows could reduce time spent on route organization.
Potentially useful for dispatch, maintenance scheduling, and asset movement decisions.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG ON AIR features Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska discussing how AI is already integrated into audit work, from tools that analyse full data populations to conversational assistants and the KPMG Clara platform. The episode covers practical applications, client benefits, auditor skill changes, and issues around data security and regulation.
bullets: AI supports repetitive tasks, large-data analysis and decision-making in audits.
Tools highlighted include an AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI (conversational assistant/agents) and the KPMG Clara platform.
Shift from sampling to full-population analysis enables more comprehensive audit coverage.
Clara for Clients improves real-time management and modern client–auditor communication.
Key challenges discussed: auditor adaptation, data security, regulatory environment and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Expect audits to use full-population analytics—ensure auditors can access comprehensive logs and datasets for accurate assessments.
Real-time audit platforms and client portals can improve operational visibility—consider how audit outputs integrate with your monitoring processes.
Data security and regulatory compliance are central when sharing infrastructure and telemetry with auditors using AI tools.
Auditor workflows are changing; support collaboration and upskilling so internal teams can work effectively with AI-enabled audit processes.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and ships with NVIDIA DLSS 4 featuring Multi Frame Generation. The launch trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator exploring Talos-II.
The game launch includes support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Trailer footage captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Description links: NVIDIA DLSS 4 announcement and official Arknights: Endfield site.
Social channels and GeForce community links provided for follow-up and updates.
takeaways: Wider adoption of DLSS 4 in commercial titles suggests demand for GPUs that support DLSS 4 and Multi Frame Generation.
Multi Frame Generation used at 4K implies potential for higher frame throughput or quality-per-watt considerations in cloud gaming and render farms.
Recorded capture on an RTX 5080 indicates developers are leveraging next-generation GPU features for promotional content and potentially for in-game use.
Procurement for game capture, streaming, or cloud-rendering should prioritize hardware compatibility with DLSS 4/MFG to support modern upscaling workflows.
